thread.title: Wahconah's Basililere is 4th in W. Mass girls golf tourney
thread.title_full: Wahconah's Basililere is 4th in W. Mass girls golf tourney

author: sports@berkshireeagle.com
title: Wahconah's Basililere is 4th in W. Mass girls golf tourney
text:
Posted: 10/01/2015 11:30:18 PM EDT Updated: 10/01/2015 11:30:18 PM EDT 
CHICOPEE >> Wahconah golfer Colette Basiliere is the fourth-best female high school golfer in Western Massachusetts. 
Basiliere shot 90 at the Chicopee Country Club on Thursday and finished fourth in the Western Mass. girls individual tournament. 
Alia Godek of Agawam shot a 79 to win the tournament. She beat teammate Angela Garvin by four shots. 
Godek is the daughter of Dean Godek, a longtime top amateur in Western Mass. golf circles. 
Lexi Shumsky of Monument Mountain and Lucy Schwartz of Lenox finished in the top 10. Shumsky shot 98 and Schwartz shot 102 over the 18 holes at Chicopee. 
MT. GREYLOCK 175, DRURY 191 
After a slow, soggy start at Waubeeka Golf Links in Williamstown, the Mounties (10-1)swept past the Blue Devils, thanks in part to a strong finish by junior Kyle Alvarez. Well over par after four holes of the par-36 front nine, Alvarez regrouped down the stretch with a performance that featured a birdie on eight. 
"The greens played tough and really slow as they were still wet," said Greylock coach Brian Gill. "You had to hit really hard puts to get them to drop." 
Nick Bator was the bright spot for Drury, earning medalist honors with a 39 that included a birdie on the fourth hole. MOUNT GREYLOCK (175): Matt Wiserman 41, Lilly Crolius 48, Ben Gilooly 41, Kyle Alvarez 45, Bennett Zimmerman 50, Owen Jones 49. Advertisement DRURY(191): Nick Bator 39, Nick Boulger 47, Chad Lawerence 50, Jude Collins 67, Ryan Baran 55, Connor Kelly 57. Birdies — Bator (No. 4), Owens (No.4), Alvarez (No.8) 
MCCANN TECH 10 1/2, MOHAWK 7 1/2 
In Adams, McCann Tech improved to 3-4-1 with its win over Mohawk. 
Playing at the Forest Park Country Club, Cole Kratz, Ryan Meehan and Brian Boudreau swept their competition. Bradley Tatro tied at the No. 1 spot. 
Mohawk's Andy Robertson and Sam Nelson were the lone winners at No. 4 and No. 6, respectively. 
——— McCANN: 10 1/2: Bradley Tatro 48 (2), Cole Kratz 45 (4), Ryan Meehan 48 (4), Jake Tower 57 (1 1/2), Brian Boudreau 45 (4), Tristian McNay 63 (1). MOHAWK: 7 1/2: Aaron Nelson 50 (2), Tristan Lacross 55 (0), Will Guyette 72 (0), Andy Roberston 51 (2 1/2), Guy Rice-Lesure 67 (0), Sam Nelson 58 (3).
